intro: Anaitis acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco anaitis, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
